thread.title: Charity wants airstrike inquiry by international panel
thread.title_full: Charity wants airstrike inquiry by international panel

title: Charity wants airstrike inquiry by international panel
text:
07 Charity wants airstrike inquiry by international panel 
CNN: Doctors Without Borders, calling the U.S. airstrike on its hospital in Kunduz, Afghanistan, an "attack on the Geneva Conventions," is asking for an independent investigation by a never-before-used international commission.The International Humanitarian Fact-Finding Commission has been in existence since 1991. It requires a request by one of the 76 nations that have signed on to it for it to begin its work. Its job is to investigate whether international humanitarian law has been violated.
